lines.value: THESEUS
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Now, fair Hippolyta, our nuptial hour
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Draws on apace; four happy days bring in
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Another moon: but, O, methinks, how slow
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: This old moon wanes! she lingers my desires,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Like to a step-dame or a dowager
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Long withering out a young man revenue.
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: HIPPOLYTA
lines.speaker: HIPPOLYTA

lines.value: Four days will quickly steep themselves in night;
lines.speaker: HIPPOLYTA

lines.value: Four nights will quickly dream away the time;
lines.speaker: HIPPOLYTA

lines.value: And then the moon, like to a silver bow
lines.speaker: HIPPOLYTA

lines.value: New-bent in heaven, shall behold the night
lines.speaker: HIPPOLYTA

lines.value: Of our solemnities.
lines.speaker: HIPPOLYTA

lines.value: THESEUS
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Go, Philostrate,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Stir up the Athenian youth to merriments;
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Awake the pert and nimble spirit of mirth;
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Turn melancholy forth to funerals;
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: The pale companion is not for our pomp.
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Hippolyta, I woo'd thee with my sword,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: And won thy love, doing thee injuries;
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: But I will wed thee in another key,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: With pomp, with triumph and with revelling.
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: EGEUS
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Happy be Theseus, our renowned duke!
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: THESEUS
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Thanks, good Egeus: what's the news with thee?
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: EGEUS
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Full of vexation come I, with complaint
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Against my child, my daughter Hermia.
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Stand forth, Demetrius. My noble lord,
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: This man hath my consent to marry her.
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Stand forth, Lysander: and my gracious duke,
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: This man hath bewitch'd the bosom of my child;
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Thou, thou, Lysander, thou hast given her rhymes,
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: And interchanged love-tokens with my child:
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Thou hast by moonlight at her window sung,
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: With feigning voice verses of feigning love,
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: And stolen the impression of her fantasy
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: With bracelets of thy hair, rings, gawds, conceits,
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Knacks, trifles, nosegays, sweetmeats, messengers
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Of strong prevailment in unharden'd youth:
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: With cunning hast thou filch'd my daughter's heart,
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Turn'd her obedience, which is due to me,
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: To stubborn harshness: and, my gracious duke,
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Be it so she; will not here before your grace
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Consent to marry with Demetrius,
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: I beg the ancient privilege of Athens,
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: As she is mine, I may dispose of her:
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Which shall be either to this gentleman
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Or to her death, according to our law
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Immediately provided in that case.
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: THESEUS
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: What say you, Hermia? be advised fair maid:
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: To you your father should be as a god;
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: One that composed your beauties, yea, and one
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: To whom you are but as a form in wax
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: By him imprinted and within his power
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: To leave the figure or disfigure it.
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Demetrius is a worthy gentleman.
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: So is Lysander.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: THESEUS
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: In himself he is;
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: But in this kind, wanting your father's voice,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: The other must be held the worthier.
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: I would my father look'd but with my eyes.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: THESEUS
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Rather your eyes must with his judgment look.
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: I do entreat your grace to pardon me.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: I know not by what power I am made bold,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Nor how it may concern my modesty,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: In such a presence here to plead my thoughts;
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: But I beseech your grace that I may know
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: The worst that may befall me in this case,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: If I refuse to wed Demetrius.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: THESEUS
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Either to die the death or to abjure
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: For ever the society of men.
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Therefore, fair Hermia, question your desires;
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Know of your youth, examine well your blood,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Whether, if you yield not to your father's choice,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: You can endure the livery of a nun,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: For aye to be in shady cloister mew'd,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: To live a barren sister all your life,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Chanting faint hymns to the cold fruitless moon.
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Thrice-blessed they that master so their blood,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: To undergo such maiden pilgrimage;
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: But earthlier happy is the rose distill'd,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Than that which withering on the virgin thorn
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Grows, lives and dies in single blessedness.
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: So will I grow, so live, so die, my lord,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Ere I will my virgin patent up
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Unto his lordship, whose unwished yoke
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: My soul consents not to give sovereignty.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: THESEUS
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Take time to pause; and, by the next new moon--
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: The sealing-day betwixt my love and me,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: For everlasting bond of fellowship--
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Upon that day either prepare to die
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: For disobedience to your father's will,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Or else to wed Demetrius, as he would;
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Or on Diana's altar to protest
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: For aye austerity and single life.
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Relent, sweet Hermia: and, Lysander, yield
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Thy crazed title to my certain right.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: You have her father's love, Demetrius;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Let me have Hermia's: do you marry him.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: EGEUS
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: Scornful Lysander! true, he hath my love,
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: And what is mine my love shall render him.
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: And she is mine, and all my right of her
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: I do estate unto Demetrius.
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: I am, my lord, as well derived as he,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: As well possess'd; my love is more than his;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: My fortunes every way as fairly rank'd,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: If not with vantage, as Demetrius';
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And, which is more than all these boasts can be,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: I am beloved of beauteous Hermia:
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Why should not I then prosecute my right?
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Demetrius, I'll avouch it to his head,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Made love to Nedar's daughter, Helena,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And won her soul; and she, sweet lady, dotes,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Devoutly dotes, dotes in idolatry,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Upon this spotted and inconstant man.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: THESEUS
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: I must confess that I have heard so much,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: And with Demetrius thought to have spoke thereof;
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: But, being over-full of self-affairs,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: My mind did lose it. But, Demetrius, come;
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: And come, Egeus; you shall go with me,
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: I have some private schooling for you both.
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: For you, fair Hermia, look you arm yourself
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: To fit your fancies to your father's will;
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Or else the law of Athens yields you up--
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Which by no means we may extenuate--
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: To death, or to a vow of single life.
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Come, my Hippolyta: what cheer, my love?
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Demetrius and Egeus, go along:
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: I must employ you in some business
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Against our nuptial and confer with you
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: Of something nearly that concerns yourselves.
lines.speaker: THESEUS

lines.value: EGEUS
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: With duty and desire we follow you.
lines.speaker: EGEUS

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: How now, my love! why is your cheek so pale?
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: How chance the roses there do fade so fast?
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Belike for want of rain, which I could well
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Beteem them from the tempest of my eyes.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Ay me! for aught that I could ever read,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Could ever hear by tale or history,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: The course of true love never did run smooth;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: But, either it was different in blood,--
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: O cross! too high to be enthrall'd to low.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Or else misgraffed in respect of years,--
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: O spite! too old to be engaged to young.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Or else it stood upon the choice of friends,--
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: O hell! to choose love by another's eyes.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Or, if there were a sympathy in choice,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: War, death, or sickness did lay siege to it,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Making it momentany as a sound,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Swift as a shadow, short as any dream;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Brief as the lightning in the collied night,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: That, in a spleen, unfolds both heaven and earth,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And ere a man hath power to say 'Behold!'
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: The jaws of darkness do devour it up:
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: So quick bright things come to confusion.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: If then true lovers have been ever cross'd,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: It stands as an edict in destiny:
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Then let us teach our trial patience,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Because it is a customary cross,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: As due to love as thoughts and dreams and sighs,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Wishes and tears, poor fancy's followers.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: A good persuasion: therefore, hear me, Hermia.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: I have a widow aunt, a dowager
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Of great revenue, and she hath no child:
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: From Athens is her house remote seven leagues;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And she respects me as her only son.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: There, gentle Hermia, may I marry thee;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And to that place the sharp Athenian law
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Cannot pursue us. If thou lovest me then,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Steal forth thy father's house to-morrow night;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And in the wood, a league without the town,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Where I did meet thee once with Helena,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: To do observance to a morn of May,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: There will I stay for thee.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: My good Lysander!
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: I swear to thee, by Cupid's strongest bow,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: By his best arrow with the golden head,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: By the simplicity of Venus' doves,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: By that which knitteth souls and prospers loves,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: And by that fire which burn'd the Carthage queen,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: When the false Troyan under sail was seen,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: By all the vows that ever men have broke,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: In number more than ever women spoke,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: In that same place thou hast appointed me,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: To-morrow truly will I meet with thee.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Keep promise, love. Look, here comes Helena.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: God speed fair Helena! whither away?
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Call you me fair? that fair again unsay.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Demetrius loves your fair: O happy fair!
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Your eyes are lode-stars; and your tongue's sweet air
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: More tuneable than lark to shepherd's ear,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: When wheat is green, when hawthorn buds appear.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Sickness is catching: O, were favour so,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Yours would I catch, fair Hermia, ere I go;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: My ear should catch your voice, my eye your eye,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: My tongue should catch your tongue's sweet melody.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Were the world mine, Demetrius being bated,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: The rest I'd give to be to you translated.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: O, teach me how you look, and with what art
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: You sway the motion of Demetrius' heart.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: I frown upon him, yet he loves me still.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: O that your frowns would teach my smiles such skill!
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: I give him curses, yet he gives me love.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: O that my prayers could such affection move!
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: The more I hate, the more he follows me.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: The more I love, the more he hateth me.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: His folly, Helena, is no fault of mine.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: None, but your beauty: would that fault were mine!
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Take comfort: he no more shall see my face;
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Lysander and myself will fly this place.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Before the time I did Lysander see,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Seem'd Athens as a paradise to me:
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: O, then, what graces in my love do dwell,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: That he hath turn'd a heaven unto a hell!
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Helen, to you our minds we will unfold:
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: To-morrow night, when Phoebe doth behold
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Her silver visage in the watery glass,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Decking with liquid pearl the bladed grass,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: A time that lovers' flights doth still conceal,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Through Athens' gates have we devised to steal.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: And in the wood, where often you and I
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Upon faint primrose-beds were wont to lie,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Emptying our bosoms of their counsel sweet,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: There my Lysander and myself shall meet;
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: And thence from Athens turn away our eyes,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: To seek new friends and stranger companies.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Farewell, sweet playfellow: pray thou for us;
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: And good luck grant thee thy Demetrius!
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Keep word, Lysander: we must starve our sight
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: From lovers' food till morrow deep midnight.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: I will, my Hermia.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Helena, adieu:
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: As you on him, Demetrius dote on you!
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: How happy some o'er other some can be!
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Through Athens I am thought as fair as she.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: But what of that? Demetrius thinks not so;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: He will not know what all but he do know:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: And as he errs, doting on Hermia's eyes,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: So I, admiring of his qualities:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Things base and vile, folding no quantity,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Love can transpose to form and dignity:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: And therefore is wing'd Cupid painted blind:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Nor hath Love's mind of any judgement taste;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Wings and no eyes figure unheedy haste:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: And therefore is Love said to be a child,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Because in choice he is so oft beguiled.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: As waggish boys in game themselves forswear,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: So the boy Love is perjured every where:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: For ere Demetrius look'd on Hermia's eyne,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: He hail'd down oaths that he was only mine;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: And when this hail some heat from Hermia felt,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: So he dissolved, and showers of oaths did melt.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: I will go tell him of fair Hermia's flight:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Then to the wood will he to-morrow night
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Pursue her; and for this intelligence
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: If I have thanks, it is a dear expense:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: But herein mean I to enrich my pain,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: To have his sight thither and back again.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: QUINCE
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: Is all our company here?
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: BOTTOM
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: You were best to call them generally, man by man,
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: according to the scrip.
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: QUINCE
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: Here is the scroll of every man's name, which is
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: thought fit, through all Athens, to play in our
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: interlude before the duke and the duchess, on his
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: wedding-day at night.
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: BOTTOM
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: First, good Peter Quince, say what the play treats
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: on, then read the names of the actors, and so grow
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: to a point.
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: QUINCE
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: Marry, our play is, The most lamentable comedy, and
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.speaker: Fairy

lines.speaker: Fairy

lines.value: The cowslips tall her pensioners be:
lines.speaker: Fairy

lines.value: Fetch me this herb; and be thou here again
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Ere the leviathan can swim a league.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: PUCK
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: I'll put a girdle round about the earth
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: In forty minutes.
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: OBERON
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Having once this juice,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: I'll watch Titania when she is asleep,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And drop the liquor of it in her eyes.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: The next thing then she waking looks upon,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Be it on lion, bear, or wolf, or bull,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: On meddling monkey, or on busy ape,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: She shall pursue it with the soul of love:
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And ere I take this charm from off her sight,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: As I can take it with another herb,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: I'll make her render up her page to me.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: But who comes here? I am invisible;
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And I will overhear their conference.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: I love thee not, therefore pursue me not.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Where is Lysander and fair Hermia?
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: The one I'll slay, the other slayeth me.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Thou told'st me they were stolen unto this wood;
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: And here am I, and wode within this wood,
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Because I cannot meet my Hermia.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Hence, get thee gone, and follow me no more.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: You draw me, you hard-hearted adamant;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: But yet you draw not iron, for my heart
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Is true as steel: leave you your power to draw,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: And I shall have no power to follow you.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Do I entice you? do I speak you fair?
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Or, rather, do I not in plainest truth
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Tell you, I do not, nor I cannot love you?
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: And even for that do I love you the more.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: I am your spaniel; and, Demetrius,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: The more you beat me, I will fawn on you:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Use me but as your spaniel, spurn me, strike me,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Neglect me, lose me; only give me leave,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Unworthy as I am, to follow you.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: What worser place can I beg in your love,--
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: And yet a place of high respect with me,--
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Than to be used as you use your dog?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Tempt not too much the hatred of my spirit;
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: For I am sick when I do look on thee.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: And I am sick when I look not on you.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: You do impeach your modesty too much,
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: To leave the city and commit yourself
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Into the hands of one that loves you not;
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: To trust the opportunity of night
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: And the ill counsel of a desert place
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: With the rich worth of your virginity.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Your virtue is my privilege: for that
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: It is not night when I do see your face,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Therefore I think I am not in the night;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Nor doth this wood lack worlds of company,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: For you in my respect are all the world:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Then how can it be said I am alone,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: When all the world is here to look on me?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: I'll run from thee and hide me in the brakes,
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: And leave thee to the mercy of wild beasts.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: The wildest hath not such a heart as you.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Run when you will, the story shall be changed:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Apollo flies, and Daphne holds the chase;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: The dove pursues the griffin; the mild hind
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Makes speed to catch the tiger; bootless speed,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: When cowardice pursues and valour flies.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: I will not stay thy questions; let me go:
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Or, if thou follow me, do not believe
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: But I shall do thee mischief in the wood.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Ay, in the temple, in the town, the field,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: You do me mischief. Fie, Demetrius!
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Your wrongs do set a scandal on my sex:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: We cannot fight for love, as men may do;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: We should be wood and were not made to woo.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: I'll follow thee and make a heaven of hell,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: To die upon the hand I love so well.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: OBERON
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Fare thee well, nymph: ere he do leave this grove,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Thou shalt fly him and he shall seek thy love.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Hast thou the flower there? Welcome, wanderer.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: PUCK
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Ay, there it is.
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: OBERON
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: I pray thee, give it me.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: I know a bank where the wild thyme blows,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Where oxlips and the nodding violet grows,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Quite over-canopied with luscious woodbine,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: With sweet musk-roses and with eglantine:
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: There sleeps Titania sometime of the night,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Lull'd in these flowers with dances and delight;
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And there the snake throws her enamell'd skin,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Weed wide enough to wrap a fairy in:
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And with the juice of this I'll streak her eyes,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And make her full of hateful fantasies.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Take thou some of it, and seek through this grove:
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: A sweet Athenian lady is in love
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: With a disdainful youth: anoint his eyes;
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: But do it when the next thing he espies
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: May be the lady: thou shalt know the man
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: By the Athenian garments he hath on.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Effect it with some care, that he may prove
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: More fond on her than she upon her love:
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And look thou meet me ere the first cock crow.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: PUCK
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Fear not, my lord, your servant shall do so.
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: TITANIA
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Come, now a roundel and a fairy song;
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Then, for the third part of a minute, hence;
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Some to kill cankers in the musk-rose buds,
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Some war with rere-mice for their leathern wings,
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: To make my small elves coats, and some keep back
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: The clamorous owl that nightly hoots and wonders
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: At our quaint spirits. Sing me now asleep;
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Then to your offices and let me rest.
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: You spotted snakes with double tongue,
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Thorny hedgehogs, be not seen;
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Newts and blind-worms, do no wrong,
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Come not near our fairy queen.
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Philomel, with melody
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Sing in our sweet lullaby;
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Lulla, lulla, lullaby, lulla, lulla, lullaby:
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Never harm,
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Nor spell nor charm,
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Come our lovely lady nigh;
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: So, good night, with lullaby.
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Weaving spiders, come not here;
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Hence, you long-legg'd spinners, hence!
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Beetles black, approach not near;
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Worm nor snail, do no offence.
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Philomel, with melody,  & c.
lines.speaker: TITANIA

lines.value: Fairy
lines.speaker: Fairy

lines.value: Hence, away! now all is well:
lines.speaker: Fairy

lines.value: One aloof stand sentinel.
lines.speaker: Fairy

lines.value: OBERON
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: What thou seest when thou dost wake,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Do it for thy true-love take,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Love and languish for his sake:
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Be it ounce, or cat, or bear,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Pard, or boar with bristled hair,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: In thy eye that shall appear
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: When thou wakest, it is thy dear:
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Wake when some vile thing is near.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Fair love, you faint with wandering in the wood;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And to speak troth, I have forgot our way:
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: We'll rest us, Hermia, if you think it good,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And tarry for the comfort of the day.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Be it so, Lysander: find you out a bed;
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: For I upon this bank will rest my head.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: One turf shall serve as pillow for us both;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: One heart, one bed, two bosoms and one troth.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Nay, good Lysander; for my sake, my dear,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Lie further off yet, do not lie so near.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: O, take the sense, sweet, of my innocence!
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Love takes the meaning in love's conference.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: I mean, that my heart unto yours is knit
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: So that but one heart we can make of it;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Two bosoms interchained with an oath;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: So then two bosoms and a single troth.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Then by your side no bed-room me deny;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: For lying so, Hermia, I do not lie.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Lysander riddles very prettily:
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Now much beshrew my manners and my pride,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: If Hermia meant to say Lysander lied.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: But, gentle friend, for love and courtesy
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Lie further off; in human modesty,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Such separation as may well be said
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Becomes a virtuous bachelor and a maid,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: So far be distant; and, good night, sweet friend:
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Thy love ne'er alter till thy sweet life end!
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Amen, amen, to that fair prayer, say I;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And then end life when I end loyalty!
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Here is my bed: sleep give thee all his rest!
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: With half that wish the wisher's eyes be press'd!
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: PUCK
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Through the forest have I gone.
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: But Athenian found I none,
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: On whose eyes I might approve
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: This flower's force in stirring love.
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Night and silence.--Who is here?
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Weeds of Athens he doth wear:
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: This is he, my master said,
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Despised the Athenian maid;
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: And here the maiden, sleeping sound,
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: On the dank and dirty ground.
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Pretty soul! she durst not lie
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Near this lack-love, this kill-courtesy.
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Churl, upon thy eyes I throw
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: All the power this charm doth owe.
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: When thou wakest, let love forbid
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Sleep his seat on thy eyelid:
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: So awake when I am gone;
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: For I must now to Oberon.
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Stay, though thou kill me, sweet Demetrius.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: I charge thee, hence, and do not haunt me thus.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: O, wilt thou darkling leave me? do not so.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Stay, on thy peril: I alone will go.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: O, I am out of breath in this fond chase!
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: The more my prayer, the lesser is my grace.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Happy is Hermia, wheresoe'er she lies;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: For she hath blessed and attractive eyes.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: How came her eyes so bright? Not with salt tears:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: If so, my eyes are oftener wash'd than hers.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: No, no, I am as ugly as a bear;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: For beasts that meet me run away for fear:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Therefore no marvel though Demetrius
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Do, as a monster fly my presence thus.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: What wicked and dissembling glass of mine
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Made me compare with Hermia's sphery eyne?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: But who is here? Lysander! on the ground!
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Dead? or asleep? I see no blood, no wound.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Lysander if you live, good sir, awake.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: [Awaking]  And run through fire I will for thy sweet sake.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Transparent Helena! Nature shows art,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: That through thy bosom makes me see thy heart.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Where is Demetrius? O, how fit a word
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Is that vile name to perish on my sword!
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Do not say so, Lysander; say not so
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: What though he love your Hermia? Lord, what though?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Yet Hermia still loves you: then be content.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Content with Hermia! No; I do repent
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: The tedious minutes I with her have spent.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Not Hermia but Helena I love:
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Who will not change a raven for a dove?
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: The will of man is by his reason sway'd;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And reason says you are the worthier maid.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Things growing are not ripe until their season
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: So I, being young, till now ripe not to reason;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And touching now the point of human skill,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Reason becomes the marshal to my will
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And leads me to your eyes, where I o'erlook
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Love's stories written in love's richest book.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Wherefore was I to this keen mockery born?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: When at your hands did I deserve this scorn?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Is't not enough, is't not enough, young man,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: That I did never, no, nor never can,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Deserve a sweet look from Demetrius' eye,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: But you must flout my insufficiency?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Good troth, you do me wrong, good sooth, you do,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: In such disdainful manner me to woo.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: But fare you well: perforce I must confess
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: I thought you lord of more true gentleness.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: O, that a lady, of one man refused.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Should of another therefore be abused!
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: She sees not Hermia. Hermia, sleep thou there:
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And never mayst thou come Lysander near!
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: For as a surfeit of the sweetest things
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: The deepest loathing to the stomach brings,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Or as tie heresies that men do leave
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Are hated most of those they did deceive,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: So thou, my surfeit and my heresy,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Of all be hated, but the most of me!
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And, all my powers, address your love and might
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: To honour Helen and to be her knight!
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: [Awaking]  Help me, Lysander, help me! do thy best
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: To pluck this crawling serpent from my breast!
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Ay me, for pity! what a dream was here!
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Lysander, look how I do quake with fear:
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Methought a serpent eat my heart away,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: And you sat smiling at his cruel pray.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Lysander! what, removed? Lysander! lord!
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: What, out of hearing? gone? no sound, no word?
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Alack, where are you speak, an if you hear;
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Speak, of all loves! I swoon almost with fear.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: No? then I well perceive you all not nigh
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Either death or you I'll find immediately.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: BOTTOM
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: Are we all met?
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: QUINCE
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: Pat, pat; and here's a marvellous convenient place
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: for our rehearsal. This green plot shall be our
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: stage, this hawthorn-brake our tiring-house; and we
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: will do it in action as we will do it before the duke.
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: BOTTOM
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: Peter Quince,--
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: QUINCE
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: What sayest thou, bully Bottom?
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: BOTTOM
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: There are things in this comedy of Pyramus and
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: Thisby that will never please. First, Pyramus must
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: draw a sword to kill himself; which the ladies
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: cannot abide. How answer you that?
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: SNOUT
lines.speaker: SNOUT

lines.value: By'r lakin, a parlous fear.
lines.speaker: SNOUT

lines.value: STARVELING
lines.speaker: STARVELING

lines.value: I believe we must leave the killing out, when all is done.
lines.speaker: STARVELING

lines.value: BOTTOM
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: Not a whit: I have a device to make all well.
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: Write me a prologue; and let the prologue seem to
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: say, we will do no harm with our swords, and that
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: Pyramus is not killed indeed; and, for the more
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: better assurance, tell them that I, Pyramus, am not
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: Pyramus, but Bottom the weaver: this will put them
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: out of fear.
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: QUINCE
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: Well, we will have such a prologue; and it shall be
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: written in eight and six.
lines.speaker: QUINCE

lines.value: BOTTOM
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: No, make it two more; let it be written in eight and eight.

lines.value: BOTTOM
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: Masters, you ought to consider with yourselves: to
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: most dreadful thing; for there is not a more fearful
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: wild-fowl than your lion living; and we ought to
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: look to 't.
lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: Therefore another prologue must tell he is not a lion.
lines.speaker: SNOUT

lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.speaker: BOTTOM

lines.value: were pity of my life: no I am no such thing; I am a

lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: And hast thou kill'd him sleeping? O brave touch!
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Could not a worm, an adder, do so much?
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: An adder did it; for with doubler tongue
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Than thine, thou serpent, never adder stung.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: You spend your passion on a misprised mood:
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: I am not guilty of Lysander's blood;
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Nor is he dead, for aught that I can tell.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: I pray thee, tell me then that he is well.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: An if I could, what should I get therefore?
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: A privilege never to see me more.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: And from thy hated presence part I so:
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: See me no more, whether he be dead or no.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: There is no following her in this fierce vein:
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Here therefore for a while I will remain.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: So sorrow's heaviness doth heavier grow
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: For debt that bankrupt sleep doth sorrow owe:
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Which now in some slight measure it will pay,
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: If for his tender here I make some stay.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: OBERON
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: What hast thou done? thou hast mistaken quite
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And laid the love-juice on some true-love's sight:
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Of thy misprision must perforce ensue
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Some true love turn'd and not a false turn'd true.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: PUCK
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Then fate o'er-rules, that, one man holding troth,
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: A million fail, confounding oath on oath.
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: OBERON
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: About the wood go swifter than the wind,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And Helena of Athens look thou find:
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: All fancy-sick she is and pale of cheer,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: With sighs of love, that costs the fresh blood dear:
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: By some illusion see thou bring her here:
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: I'll charm his eyes against she do appear.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: PUCK
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: I go, I go; look how I go,
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Swifter than arrow from the Tartar's bow.
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: OBERON
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Flower of this purple dye,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Hit with Cupid's archery,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Sink in apple of his eye.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: When his love he doth espy,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Let her shine as gloriously
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: As the Venus of the sky.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: When thou wakest, if she be by,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Beg of her for remedy.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: PUCK
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Captain of our fairy band,
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Helena is here at hand;
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: And the youth, mistook by me,
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Pleading for a lover's fee.
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Shall we their fond pageant see?
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Lord, what fools these mortals be!
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: OBERON
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Stand aside: the noise they make
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Will cause Demetrius to awake.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: PUCK
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Then will two at once woo one;
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: That must needs be sport alone;
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: And those things do best please me
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: That befal preposterously.
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Why should you think that I should woo in scorn?
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Scorn and derision never come in tears:
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Look, when I vow, I weep; and vows so born,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: In their nativity all truth appears.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: How can these things in me seem scorn to you,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Bearing the badge of faith, to prove them true?
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: You do advance your cunning more and more.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: When truth kills truth, O devilish-holy fray!
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: These vows are Hermia's: will you give her o'er?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Weigh oath with oath, and you will nothing weigh:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Your vows to her and me, put in two scales,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Will even weigh, and both as light as tales.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: I had no judgment when to her I swore.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Nor none, in my mind, now you give her o'er.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Demetrius loves her, and he loves not you.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: [Awaking]  O Helena, goddess, nymph, perfect, divine!
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: To what, my love, shall I compare thine eyne?
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Crystal is muddy. O, how ripe in show
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Thy lips, those kissing cherries, tempting grow!
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: That pure congealed white, high Taurus snow,
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Fann'd with the eastern wind, turns to a crow
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: When thou hold'st up thy hand: O, let me kiss
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: This princess of pure white, this seal of bliss!
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: O spite! O hell! I see you all are bent
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: To set against me for your merriment:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: If you we re civil and knew courtesy,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: You would not do me thus much injury.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Can you not hate me, as I know you do,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: But you must join in souls to mock me too?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: If you were men, as men you are in show,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: You would not use a gentle lady so;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: To vow, and swear, and superpraise my parts,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: When I am sure you hate me with your hearts.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: You both are rivals, and love Hermia;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: And now both rivals, to mock Helena:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: A trim exploit, a manly enterprise,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: To conjure tears up in a poor maid's eyes
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: With your derision! none of noble sort
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Would so offend a virgin, and extort
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: A poor soul's patience, all to make you sport.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: You are unkind, Demetrius; be not so;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: For you love Hermia; this you know I know:
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And here, with all good will, with all my heart,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: In Hermia's love I yield you up my part;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And yours of Helena to me bequeath,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Whom I do love and will do till my death.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Never did mockers waste more idle breath.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Lysander, keep thy Hermia; I will none:
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: If e'er I loved her, all that love is gone.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: My heart to her but as guest-wise sojourn'd,
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: And now to Helen is it home return'd,
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: There to remain.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Helen, it is not so.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Disparage not the faith thou dost not know,
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Lest, to thy peril, thou aby it dear.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Look, where thy love comes; yonder is thy dear.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Dark night, that from the eye his function takes,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: The ear more quick of apprehension makes;
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Wherein it doth impair the seeing sense,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: It pays the hearing double recompense.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Thou art not by mine eye, Lysander, found;
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Mine ear, I thank it, brought me to thy sound
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: But why unkindly didst thou leave me so?
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Why should he stay, whom love doth press to go?
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: What love could press Lysander from my side?
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Lysander's love, that would not let him bide,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Fair Helena, who more engilds the night
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Than all you fiery oes and eyes of light.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Why seek'st thou me? could not this make thee know,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: The hate I bear thee made me leave thee so?
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: You speak not as you think: it cannot be.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Lo, she is one of this confederacy!
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Now I perceive they have conjoin'd all three
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: To fashion this false sport, in spite of me.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Injurious Hermia! most ungrateful maid!
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Have you conspired, have you with these contrived
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: To bait me with this foul derision?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Is all the counsel that we two have shared,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: The sisters' vows, the hours that we have spent,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: When we have chid the hasty-footed time
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: For parting us,--O, is it all forgot?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: All school-days' friendship, childhood innocence?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: We, Hermia, like two artificial gods,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Have with our needles created both one flower,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Both on one sampler, sitting on one cushion,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Both warbling of one song, both in one key,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: As if our hands, our sides, voices and minds,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Had been incorporate. So we grow together,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Like to a double cherry, seeming parted,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: But yet an union in partition;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Two lovely berries moulded on one stem;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: So, with two seeming bodies, but one heart;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Two of the first, like coats in heraldry,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Due but to one and crowned with one crest.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: And will you rent our ancient love asunder,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: To join with men in scorning your poor friend?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: It is not friendly, 'tis not maidenly:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Our sex, as well as I, may chide you for it,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Though I alone do feel the injury.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: I am amazed at your passionate words.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: I scorn you not: it seems that you scorn me.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Have you not set Lysander, as in scorn,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: To follow me and praise my eyes and face?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: And made your other love, Demetrius,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Who even but now did spurn me with his foot,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: To call me goddess, nymph, divine and rare,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Precious, celestial? Wherefore speaks he this
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: To her he hates? and wherefore doth Lysander
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Deny your love, so rich within his soul,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: And tender me, forsooth, affection,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: But by your setting on, by your consent?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: What thought I be not so in grace as you,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: So hung upon with love, so fortunate,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: But miserable most, to love unloved?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: This you should pity rather than despise.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: HERNIA
lines.speaker: HERNIA

lines.value: I understand not what you mean by this.
lines.speaker: HERNIA

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Ay, do, persever, counterfeit sad looks,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Make mouths upon me when I turn my back;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Wink each at other; hold the sweet jest up:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: This sport, well carried, shall be chronicled.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: If you have any pity, grace, or manners,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: You would not make me such an argument.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: But fare ye well: 'tis partly my own fault;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Which death or absence soon shall remedy.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Stay, gentle Helena; hear my excuse:
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: My love, my life my soul, fair Helena!
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: O excellent!
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Sweet, do not scorn her so.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: If she cannot entreat, I can compel.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Thou canst compel no more than she entreat:
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Thy threats have no more strength than her weak prayers.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Helen, I love thee; by my life, I do:
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: I swear by that which I will lose for thee,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: To prove him false that says I love thee not.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: I say I love thee more than he can do.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: If thou say so, withdraw, and prove it too.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Quick, come!
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Lysander, whereto tends all this?
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Away, you Ethiope!
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: No, no; he'll [        ]
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Seem to break loose; take on as you would follow,
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: But yet come not: you are a tame man, go!
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Hang off, thou cat, thou burr! vile thing, let loose,
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Or I will shake thee from me like a serpent!
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Why are you grown so rude? what change is this?
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Sweet love,--
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Thy love! out, tawny Tartar, out!
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Out, loathed medicine! hated potion, hence!
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Do you not jest?
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Yes, sooth; and so do you.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Demetrius, I will keep my word with thee.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: I would I had your bond, for I perceive
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: A weak bond holds you: I'll not trust your word.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: What, should I hurt her, strike her, kill her dead?
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Although I hate her, I'll not harm her so.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: What, can you do me greater harm than hate?
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Hate me! wherefore? O me! what news, my love!
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Am not I Hermia? are not you Lysander?
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: I am as fair now as I was erewhile.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Since night you loved me; yet since night you left
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: me:
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Why, then you left me--O, the gods forbid!--
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: In earnest, shall I say?
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: LYSANDER
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Ay, by my life;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: And never did desire to see thee more.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Therefore be out of hope, of question, of doubt;
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: Be certain, nothing truer; 'tis no jest
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: That I do hate thee and love Helena.
lines.speaker: LYSANDER

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: O me! you juggler! you canker-blossom!
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: You thief of love! what, have you come by night
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: And stolen my love's heart from him?
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Fine, i'faith!
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Have you no modesty, no maiden shame,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: No touch of bashfulness? What, will you tear
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Impatient answers from my gentle tongue?
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Fie, fie! you counterfeit, you puppet, you!
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Puppet? why so? ay, that way goes the game.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Now I perceive that she hath made compare
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Between our statures; she hath urged her height;
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: And with her personage, her tall personage,
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Her height, forsooth, she hath prevail'd with him.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: And are you grown so high in his esteem;
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Because I am so dwarfish and so low?
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: How low am I, thou painted maypole? speak;
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: How low am I? I am not yet so low
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: But that my nails can reach unto thine eyes.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: I pray you, though you mock me, gentlemen,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Let her not hurt me: I was never curst;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: I have no gift at all in shrewishness;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: I am a right maid for my cowardice:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Let her not strike me. You perhaps may think,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Because she is something lower than myself,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: That I can match her.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: HERMIA
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: Lower! hark, again.
lines.speaker: HERMIA

lines.value: HELENA
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Good Hermia, do not be so bitter with me.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: I evermore did love you, Hermia,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Did ever keep your counsels, never wrong'd you;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: Save that, in love unto Demetrius,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: I told him of your stealth unto this wood.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: He follow'd you; for love I follow'd him;
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: But he hath chid me hence and threaten'd me
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: To strike me, spurn me, nay, to kill me too:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: And now, so you will let me quiet go,
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: To Athens will I bear my folly back
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: And follow you no further: let me go:
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: You see how simple and how fond I am.
lines.speaker: HELENA

lines.value: HERMIA

lines.value: OBERON

lines.value: Thou see'st these lovers seek a place to fight:
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Hie therefore, Robin, overcast the night;
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: The starry welkin cover thou anon
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: With drooping fog as black as Acheron,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And lead these testy rivals so astray
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: As one come not within another's way.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Like to Lysander sometime frame thy tongue,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Then stir Demetrius up with bitter wrong;
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And sometime rail thou like Demetrius;
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And from each other look thou lead them thus,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Till o'er their brows death-counterfeiting sleep
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: With leaden legs and batty wings doth creep:
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Then crush this herb into Lysander's eye;
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Whose liquor hath this virtuous property,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: To take from thence all error with his might,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And make his eyeballs roll with wonted sight.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: When they next wake, all this derision
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Shall seem a dream and fruitless vision,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And back to Athens shall the lovers wend,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: With league whose date till death shall never end.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Whiles I in this affair do thee employ,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: I'll to my queen and beg her Indian boy;
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And then I will her charmed eye release
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: From monster's view, and all things shall be peace.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: PUCK
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: My fairy lord, this must be done with haste,
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: For night's swift dragons cut the clouds full fast,
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: And yonder shines Aurora's harbinger;
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: At whose approach, ghosts, wandering here and there,
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Troop home to churchyards: damned spirits all,
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: That in crossways and floods have burial,
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: Already to their wormy beds are gone;
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: For fear lest day should look their shames upon,
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: They willfully themselves exile from light
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: And must for aye consort with black-brow'd night.
lines.speaker: PUCK

lines.value: OBERON
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: But we are spirits of another sort:
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: I with the morning's love have oft made sport,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: And, like a forester, the groves may tread,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Even till the eastern gate, all fiery-red,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Opening on Neptune with fair blessed beams,
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: Turns into yellow gold his salt green streams.
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: But, notwithstanding, haste; make no delay:
lines.speaker: OBERON

lines.value: We may effect this business yet ere day.
lines.speaker: OBERON
